text:
I haven’t posted any stats recently for the extension.

*1,256 weekly active users* (and steadily climbing)
We have *30 weekly active beta testers*

*English* is the most popular language for extension users, followed by *Spanish*
(did you know we support every language HubSpot officially supports?)

*U.S. and India* make up the largest populations of users.

In-case you’re wondering what HubSpot Devs use for an *operating system*:
*Mac 55%*
Windows 41%
Linux 3%
Chrome OS .8%

The Cache buster was smashed *61,158* times in June.
*195,572* Cache buster smashes since we first started tracking.

*26%* of the users are *Women*

*53%* of users are between the ages of *25* and *34*
*28%* of users are between the ages of *35* and *44*

All stats are anonymous and provided by Google Analytics. The stats are the same types of stats you would see when using it on your own website. Except severely limited(many categories of stats are not available to chrome extensions).

_We have a privacy policy if you would like to better understand how the data is used._
_<https://github.com/TheWebTech/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/Privacy-Policy_>

The code to the project is also open source so feel free to poke around.
I post this data every now and again as it is interesting, and may be useful to others in the community for their projects.
Safari doesn't really have normal extensions as far as I'm aware
